Cathie Marsh Centre for Census and Survey Research. UK Data Service</AuthEnty>         <othId>The UK Data Service (UKDS) were funded to compile this teaching dataset by the Economic and Social Research Council (ESRC) and Joint Information Systems Committee (JISC).<br> <br> The Office for National Statistics funded the main <i>Living Costs and Food Survey, 2010</i> (LCF)(held at the UK Data Archive under SN 6945), from which this dataset has been compiled. The depositors would like to thank the Office for National Statistics for their permission to repurpose the data.<br> <br> The dataset was prepared by Sarah King-Hele and Necla Acik-Toprak of the Cathie Marsh Centre for Census and Survey Research, University of Manchester.</othId>       </rspStmt>       <prodStmt>         <producer>Office for National Statistics</producer>         <copyright>Crown copyright held jointly with the UK Data Service. Crown copyright material is reproduced with the permission of the Controller of HMSO and the Queen's Printer for Scotland.  </copyright>         <fundAg>Economic and Social Research Council</fundAg>         <fundAg>Higher Education Funding Councils. Joint Information Systems Committee</fundAg>       </prodStmt>       <distStmt>         <distrbtr>UK Data Service</distrbtr>         <depositr>University of Manchester. Cathie Marsh Centre for Census and Survey Research. UK Data Service</depositr>         <depDate date="2013-02-05T00:00:00Z">05 February 2013</depDate>         <distDate date="2013-02-20T00:00:00Z">20 February 2013</distDate>       </distStmt> vocabURI="http://lod.data-archive.ac.uk/skoshasset/fe0a34b7-35a0-44ae-a464-e84d8e3ed7d1">HOUSEHOLD HEAD'S OCCUPATIONAL STATUS</keyword>         <keyword vocabURI="http://lod.data-archive.ac.uk/skoshasset/4a821930-5499-4bb4-b058-ab0ae3c8746b">UNITED KINGDOM</keyword>         <topcClas>Consumer behaviour - Economics</topcClas>         <topcClas>Income, property and investment - Economics</topcClas>         <topcClas>Teaching packages and test datasets - Reference and instructional resources</topcClas>       </subject>       <abstract><p>Abstract copyright UK Data Service and data collection copyright owner.</p>The <i>Living Costs and Food Survey, 2010: Unrestricted Access Teaching Dataset</i> is based on the <i>Living Costs and Food Survey, 2010</i> (LCF) (available from the UK Data Archive under SN 6945) and constitutes real data which are used by government, business and other organisations. The teaching dataset is a subset which has been subjected to certain simplifications and additions for the purpose of learning and teaching. <br> <br> The main differences are:<ul><li>the number of variables has been reduced</li><li>a reduced User Guide with codebook is provided</li><li>some variables have been recoded to reduce the level of detail</li></ul>Further information is available in the study documentation (see below) which includes a User Guide.<br> </abstract>       <abstract><B>Main Topics</B>:<br>Topics covered include: total expenditure; household income; socio-economic status; and household characteristics.<br> </abstract>       <sumDscr>         <timePrd event="single" date="2010-01-01T00:00:00Z">2010</timePrd>         <nation>United Kingdom</nation>         <geogUnit>Government Office Regions</geogUnit>         <universe>National</universe>         <universe>Respondents to the LCF 2010 (see SN 6945). See documentation for further details.</universe>         <dataKind>Numeric data</dataKind>         <dataKind> Individual (micro) level</dataKind>       </sumDscr>     </stdyInfo>     <method>       <dataColl>         <timeMeth>Cross-sectional (one-time) study</timeMeth>         <timeMeth>The LCF is a repeated cross-sectional study, but this teaching dataset has been compiled using only data from the LCF 2010.</timeMeth>         <sampProc>Multi-stage stratified random sample</sampProc>         <sampProc>See documentation for SN 6945 for details of LCF sampling, and the documentation for this study for details of sampling used for the teaching dataset.</sampProc>         <deviat>5,262 cases</deviat>         <collMode>Compilation or synthesis of existing material</collMode>         <collMode>The LCF is collected by face-to-face and telephone interview but the teaching dataset has been created by simplifying the original data.</collMode>         <sources>           <dataSrc>the <i>Living Costs and Food Survey, 2010</i>, available from the UK Data Archive under SN 6945.</dataSrc>         </sources>         <weight>Weighting used. See documentation for details.</weight>         <cleanOps>A*</cleanOps>       </dataColl>     </method>     <dataAccs>       <setAvail>         <accsPlac>UK Data Service</accsPlac>       </setAvail>       <useStmt>         <specPerm>Open</specPerm>         <restrctn>The depositor has specified that registration is not required.</restrctn>         <contact><a href=http://www.ukdataservice.ac.uk/help/get-in-touch.aspx>Get in touch</a></contact>         <conditions>This unrestricted access teaching dataset is freely available to download under an <a href="http://www.nationalarchives.gov.uk/doc/open-government-licence/version/2/" title="Open Government Licence">Open Government Licence</a>.</conditions>       </useStmt>     </dataAccs>     <othrStdyMat>       <relPubl>   </relPubl>       <relPubl>   </relPubl>       <othRefs>Language Of Study Description: English</othRefs>       <othRefs>Language Of Study Documentation: English</othRefs>     </othrStdyMat>   </stdyDscr> </codeBook>
